lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Lex_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/lex.Lex.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run lex.Lex.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
// Update the title above to match the actual product name
// Describe the action and its outcome.
// A description of the expected outcome goes here
LIST, TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, MARK, UNMARK, DELETE, BYE;
